content.question: If <math alttext="a sub n, equals, the n root of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mroot><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mroot></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="n equals 1, comma 2, comma 3, comma dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>…</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> , which of the following statements about <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, a, sub n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mstyle displaystyle="true" mathsize="140%"><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> must be true?

choices.label: The series converges and <math alttext="the limit as n approaches infinity, of, a, sub n, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The series diverges and <math alttext="the limit as n approaches infinity, of, a, sub n, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The series converges and <math alttext="the limit as n approaches infinity, of, a, sub n, is not equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The series diverges and <math alttext="the limit as n approaches infinity, of, a, sub n, is not equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The series diverges and <math alttext="the limit as n approaches infinity, of, a, sub n, is not equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
